snippet: In Fort Worth and elsewhere, cemetery owners find a source of revenue by leasing mineral rights for the technique known as hydraulic fracturing, or fracking.
abstract: Cemetery owners in Fort Worth, Tex, and elsewhere have found a new source of revenue by leasing mineral rights to natural gas developers who use hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, to extract the gas; trend has raised concern among activists and the families of the interred, who fear the process will damage graves.
lead_paragraph: In Fort Worth and elsewhere, cemetery owners find a source of revenue by leasing mineral rights for the technique known as hydraulic fracturing, or fracking.

headline.seo: Drilling for Natural Gas Under Cemeteries Raises Concerns
headline.main: Drilling for Gas Under Cemeteries Raises Concerns
headline.print_headline: Drilling for Gas Under Cemeteries Raises Concerns
